Welcome to my personal website! I'm Neil and I'm building safe AI systems designed to work with and for humans. 

I'm currently a doctoral researcher at the [University of Oxford](https://www.ox.ac.uk/)'s [Human Centred Computing](https://hcc.cs.ox.ac.uk/) theme. [Reuben Binns](https://www.reubenbinns.com/) and [Sir Nigel Shadbolt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigel_Shadbolt) are my supervisors. And my research focuses on using AI systems alongside human collaborators to perform tasks better than either humans or AIs can alone.

I'm also a research consultant for the [Rise](https://www.risefortheworld.org/) program, a joint initiative of [Schmidt Futures](https://www.schmidtfutures.com/) and the [Rhodes Trust](https://www.rhodeshouse.ox.ac.uk/), building AI tools to assist in the selection of the Rise program winners.

In my free time, I read books; run middle-distance; and play badminton, the piano, and video games.
